    • Method Detail

      • clamp

        public static double clamp(double value,
                           double min,
                           double max)
        Clamps a value between a minimum and a maximum value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to clamp.
        min - The minimum value of the range. This value must be less than max.
        max - The maximum value of the range. This value must be greater than min.
        Returns:
        the clamped value.
        Since:
        0.2

      • epsilonEquals

        public static boolean epsilonEquals(double a,
                                    double b)
        Checks if two numbers are equal to each other using the default epsilon.
        Parameters:
        a - The first number.
        b - The second number.
        Returns:
        If the two numbers are equal.
        Since:
        0.1

      • epsilonEquals

        public static boolean epsilonEquals(double a,
                                    double b,
                                    double epsilon)
        Checks if two numbers are equal to each other.
        Parameters:
        a - The first number
        b - The second number
        epsilon - The epsilon the comparison will use. Think of this as the allowable difference between the two numbers.
        Returns:
        If the numbers are equal.
        Since:
        0.1

      • isInRange

        public static boolean isInRange(double lowerBound,
                                double upperBound,
                                double value)
        Returns if the value is in the range [lowerBound, upperBound].
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The lower bound of the range.
        upperBound - The upper bound of the range.
        value - The value.
        Returns:
        If the value is in the range.
        Since:
        0.1

      • quadratic

        public static double[] quadratic(double a,
                                 double b,
                                 double c)
        Solves the equation 0 = ax2 + bx + c for x and returns the real results.
        Parameters:
        a - the a coefficient
        b - the b coefficient
        c - the c coefficient
        Returns:
        the real roots of the equation
